    • Constructor Detail

      • InterproceduralConstantValuePropagator

        public InterproceduralConstantValuePropagator(IInfoflowCFG icfg)
        Creates a new instance of the InterproceduralConstantValuePropagator class
        Parameters:
        icfg - The interprocedural control flow graph to use

      • InterproceduralConstantValuePropagator

        public InterproceduralConstantValuePropagator(IInfoflowCFG icfg,
                                              java.util.Collection<soot.SootMethod> excludedMethods,
                                              ISourceSinkManager sourceSinkManager,
                                              ITaintPropagationWrapper taintWrapper)
        Creates a new instance of the InterproceduralConstantValuePropagator class
        Parameters:
        icfg - The interprocedural control flow graph to use
        excludedMethods - The methods that shall be excluded. If one of these methods calls another method with a constant argument, this argument will not be propagated into the callee.
        sourceSinkManager - The SourceSinkManager to be used for not propagating constants out of source methods
        taintWrapper - The taint wrapper to be used for not breaking dummy values that will later be replaced by artificial taints

    • Method Detail

      • setRemoveSideEffectFreeMethods

        public void setRemoveSideEffectFreeMethods(boolean removeSideEffectFreeMethods)
        Sets whether side-effect free methods that do not call sinks shall be removed
        Parameters:
        removeSideEffectFreeMethods - The if side-effect free methods that do not call sinks shall be removed, otherwise false

        Checks whether constant handling is supported for the given type
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if a value of the given type can be represented as a constant, otherwise false

      • hasSideEffectsOrCallsSink

        private boolean hasSideEffectsOrCallsSink(soot.SootMethod method)
        Checks whether the given method or one of its transitive callees has side-effects or calls a sink method
        Parameters:
        method - The method to check
        Returns:
        True if the given method or one of its transitive callees has side-effects or calls a sink method, otherwise false.

      • hasSideEffectsOrCallsSink

        private boolean hasSideEffectsOrCallsSink(soot.SootMethod method,
                                          java.util.Set<soot.SootMethod> runList)
        Checks whether the given method or one of its transitive callees has side-effects or calls a sink method
        Parameters:
        method - The method to check
        runList - A set to receive all methods that have already been processed
        cache - The cache in which to store the results
        Returns:
        True if the given method or one of its transitive callees has side-effects or calls a sink method, otherwise false.

        private boolean methodIsAndroidStub(soot.SootMethod method)
        Checks whether the given method is a library stub method
        Parameters:
        method - The method to check
        Returns:

      • propagateConstantsIntoCallee

        private void propagateConstantsIntoCallee(soot.SootMethod sm)
        Checks whether all call sites for a specific callee agree on the same constant value for one or more arguments. If so, these constant values are propagated into the callee.
        Parameters:
        sm - The method for which to look for call sites.

      • getFirstNonIdentityStmt

        private soot.Unit getFirstNonIdentityStmt(soot.SootMethod sm)
        Gets the first statement in the body of the given method that does not assign the "this" local or a parameter local
        Parameters:
        sm - The method in whose body to look
        Returns:
        The first non-identity statement in the body of the given method.
